title: An interpretation of scalars in SO(32)
abstract:
We propose an interpretation for the adjoint representation of the $SO(32)$
group to classify the scalars of a generic Supersymmetric Standard Model having
just three generations of particles, via a flavour group $SU(5)$. We show that
this same interpretation arises from a simple postulate of self-consistence of
composites for these scalars. The model looks only for colour and electric
charge, and it pays the cost of an additional chiral $+4/3$ quark per
generation.
